dt: {bc}a specialized light-sensitive sensory structure of animals that in nearly all vertebrates, most arthropods, and some mollusks is the image-forming organ of sight

{bc}the nearly spherical usually paired hollow organ of sight in vertebrates that is filled with a jellylike material, is lined with a photosensitive retina, and is lodged in a bony orbit in the skull
{bc}all the visible structures within and surrounding the orbit and including eyelids, eyelashes, and eyebrows
{bc}the faculty of intellectual or aesthetic perception or appreciation

dt: {bc}something having an appearance suggestive of an eye: such as
{bc}the hole through the head of a needle
{bc}a usually circular marking (as on a peacock's tail)
{bc}a loop or catch to receive a hook
{bc}an area like a hole in the center of a tropical cyclone marked by only light winds or complete calm with no precipitation
{bc}the center of a flower especially when differently colored or marked
{bc}a triangular piece of beef cut from between the top and bottom of a round
{bc}a compact mass of muscular tissue usually embedded in fat in a rib or loin cut of meat
{bc}a device (such as a photoelectric cell) that functions in a manner analogous to human vision

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}ēage{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}ouga{/it} eye, Latin {it}oculus{/it}, Greek {it}ōps{/it} eye, face, Sanskrit {it}akṣi{/it} eye
shortdef: a specialized light-sensitive sensory structure of animals that in nearly all vertebrates, most arthropods, and some mollusks is the image-forming organ of sight; especially : the nearly spherical usually paired hollow organ of sight in vertebrates that is filled with a jellylike material, is lined with a photosensitive retina, and is lodged in a bony orbit in the skull
all the visible structures within and surrounding the orbit and including eyelids, eyelashes, and eyebrows
the faculty of seeing with eyes
